One the survey site has been polished enough (so that @StPaulTim doesn't think it's "ugly" any more :stuck_out_tongue_closed_eyes: ), I'd like us to link to it from https://backdropcms.org/roadmap

...btw, the ClassicPress folks seem to have a nice roadmap page, from which we could be inspired to improve ours: https://www.classicpress.net/roadmap

ClassicPress Roadmap
ClassicPress is under constant development and improvement. Our roadmap provides a summary of our short to medium terms plans for ClassicPress.

Is the survey page supposed to be "on" once a year (or once per minor release)? Or should it always be on?

I'm asking, because to my understanding the survey (in the current format) makes most sense, if it only happens for a certain time span. To sort of get the current mood of the community and where the direction should go. For instance to figure out, what's needed most - and potentially, what's not so urgent.

This was discussed before, and I argued that the survey should be on-going @indigoxela ...once any of the features have been implemented, they should be removed from the list + also potentially email people that voted for them, to let them know that they are now included (or when the next version of Backdrop that includes them is planned to be released). The email could also serve as a prompt to ask them to vote again for the remaining features in the list, or suggest new ones. ...that way, we can have a continuous view of what the community considers important features, and which ones not so much.

I think that this discussion belongs on Github, where there is a better history. I've opened a ticket.

I think you should let the AC module to colorize the calendar per user's each flagging. The calendar will just show what users flagged more numbers of projects each time they logged in. The current core development survey has ended. There will be discussions on if and when to reopen or create a new survey. In the meantime, the results are:

2) Allow multiple file/image uploads (13)

Upgrade UI module (similar to Migrate UI in D8) to help with moving from D7 (7)

There were 28 total participants.

I think that the result that most interested me on the survey is the interest in "recipes." This is a topic that I already cared about and a topic that I think I am able to help move forward (although, I will need help), so seeing that others are interested in it (and prioritized it) has inspired me to to invest more time in it.
Did we ever discuss what to do with this? The people have spoken. So what?

I think we made it clear from the outset that this survey was not binding in any way. It was intended to be helpful to core developers and each of us have the opportunity to use this information in our own contributions.

Having said that, I would like to discuss the results more during future development meetings. Maybe we should take some time in upcoming meetings to discuss the top issues from the survey.

We also have this issue in Github:
https://github.com/backdrop-ops/backdropcms.org/issues/758

Personally, I am inspired by the interest in "recipes" and will schedule a discussion during Backdrop LIVE to help better define what "recipes" are and how they might work.
